If that doesn't strike your fancy, I'd also recommend "Zero Effect". It's a clever and witty mystery that pays homage to classic detective films. Ben Stiller shines in his dual role as Daryl Zero, and the supporting cast is equally impressive.

If you're in the mood for something a bit more adventurous, I'd suggest "Heart of Darkness" (1910) - it's an oldie but a goodie! You'll be transported to the jungle as a detective searches for Captain Kurtz, and the mysterious atmosphere will keep you engaged.

I think I have just the thing for you! Based on your interest in something primarily in Italian, I'd recommend "A Fistful of Dollars". This classic spaghetti western is a must-see, with Clint Eastwood's iconic performance and Ennio Morricone's legendary score. The film's themes of revenge and rivalry will surely keep you engaged, without being too intense or scary.

If you're not in the mood for a western, another option could be "Unbreakable". While it may not be primarily in Italian (it has an American cast), the film does have some beautiful Italian cinematography. Plus, Bruce Willis and Samuel L. Jackson are fantastic in this superhero thriller about a man who discovers he has extraordinary abilities after a mysterious accident.

The film stars John Travolta as a sound recordist who accidentally records evidence of a murder, and it's got a similar blend of suspense and intrigue that made Unbreakable so compelling!
